metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13096 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fs/f2fs/super.c in the Linux kernel through4.14. A denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access and BUG) can occurupon encountering an abnormal bitmap size when mounting a crafted f2fsimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1034.37
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1034.37').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
